ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: It's too quiet for a bunch of musicians
ygData.msgSnippet: SoW potions and chant kite giants in the bowl under the fort is great.  i soloed Gorgul Paclock at 48-49 for the first time.  Running around the bowl can be
ygData.messageBody:
SoW potions and chant kite giants in the bowl under the fort is great. i soloed Gorgul Paclock at 48-49 for the first time. Running around the bowl can be exciting with five giants chasing you but it will get mind numbingly boring after a while.
Also, if you follow the path back to DL for a very short ways, there is a clearing to the left that is free of roamers (I call it my 'glade of death') and you can chant/sharm kite mobs in there. Wurms and bees should likely be avoided because of their high FR. The other two chants work well there and you might want to partner with a root class there, things go very fast that way.
Christopher Sanders <christopher.sanders@...> wrote: Hmmm...what did you hunt, and what was your technique in Burning Woods?
I've avoided it, because Chant of Flame doesn't stick on much of anything in
there, and it's way easy to aggro wurms and hornets. I've been sticking to
places where I can pulse lvl 49 selos, and triple chant. Takes forever when
one chant is rendered useless.

It's also nice now to not have to worry about getting SoW to triple chant
kite. :)

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 06, 2002 2:23 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: It's too quiet for a bunch of musicians



Hmmm. I grouped at orc hill from 4-7 and then went to Crushbone until 10.
From there I went to the commons (soloed a bit in butcherblock first tho) --
killed orcs in the commons till 12, then I did Dervs in the west commons
till 15 -- lake Rathetear until 18 -- East Karana to 19 then lake of ill
omen till 30 (The front of the goblin fort is great with lament to pull,
/bellows to soften them up and then all instrument twist). Spent some time
in Rathe Mtns after that learning to charm kite and then Dalnir's crypt
until 33 or 34, Overthere until 36 and then EW where I soloed from 38 to 49
there. Went to Burning Woods after that and soloed until 53.
Since then I've usually grouped because it's much safer -- xp loss post 50
is unbelievable.
Tyunes of Rodcet Nife
Bard of 56 taunts
KAZVorpal <kazvorpal@...> wrote: --- In eqbards@y...,
little_wild1@y... wrote:
> So, what, I join the list and you all get quiet? I'm only 11, my
> reputation cannot have preceded me as yet. I've been soloing in NK
> since 9, my first bard. Any words of wisdom on where to go next?

What'd be really great would be if a couple of real pros would list
where they soloed for each level(s) on their way up, like "from 12-16
I killed monsters in zone X through melee, then up to 20 I kited Pink
Volvo Demons who conned yellow, then..."

I've actually started my own list just to find out where to solo
at "higher" levels (people try to say you should give it up after
about 12th, but I prefer solo)...Soloing Everquest,
http://www.yahoogroups.com/group/soloing/

I'm going to post what I know about soloing, and data I'm
accumulating, like lists of soloable MObs (monsters) for each level,
tricks for soloing better (how to automatically raise your sense
direction, forage, mend, and other skills as fast as possible, no
button-clicking required), and other stuff.

My hope is that both people with questions and people with advice
will join the list and post, and we can get a really good
infosite/faq going after a while.
